offers a number of examples. Abbot Leofstan attempts to remove the head from St. Edmund’s body, to which it had been reattached after its decapitation and loss, but his hand is paralyzed as a result (Arnold I:54); a knight and a steward who attempt to seize a manor belonging to the Abbey are driven insane (Arnold I:79–80); Prince Eustace dies horribly after attacking lands belonging to the Abbey in the mid-twelfth century
